episodeTitle: Enter the Desert Pirates! The Men Who Live Freely!
episodeTitleJapanese: 砂漠の海賊団登場！自由に生きる男達
episodeTitleRomanized: Sabaku no Kaizokudan Tōjō! Jiyū ni Ikiru Otokotachi
description: The Straw Hat crew travels through the scorching Sandora Desert where Luffy becomes dehydrated and hallucinates after drinking from a psychoactive cactus. Meanwhile, Nami and Vivi ride ahead on Matsuge the camel. The crew encounters the Barbar Pirates and their captain Barbarossa. After Luffy accidentally damages their ship, they agree to help find wood for repairs, leading Vivi to reunite with Rasa, a girl from her past.

openingSong.title: Believe
openingSong.composer: Giancarlo Pasquini, Fabrizio Rizzolo, Sandro Oliva

events.title: Straw Hats Continue Desert Journey
events.description: The Straw Hat crew, along with Vivi and Ace, continue their journey through the scorching Sandora Desert toward Yuba. The intense heat and lack of water begin to take their toll on the crew.
events.significance: Sets the scene for the episode's desert adventures and establishes the harsh conditions the crew must endure.

events.title: Luffy's Psychoactive Cactus Hallucination Begins
events.description: Luffy becomes severely dehydrated and starts hallucinating after Usopp gave him a psychoactive cactus to drink from earlier. He begins seeing a tsunami approaching in the middle of the desert. Chopper realizes the cactus was psychoactive and is causing the hallucinations.
events.significance: Demonstrates the dangers of the desert environment and creates comedic relief. This element is actually from the manga (Chapter 162) though the full hallucination scene with Zoro occurs in Episode 102.

quotes.text: A tsunami! There's a tsunami coming!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy hallucinates seeing a tsunami in the middle of the desert

events.title: Matsuge the Camel Rescued
events.description: The Straw Hats rescue a camel from a giant Sandora Lizard attack. The camel, which has distinctive long eyelashes, is named Matsuge by Nami. However, Matsuge proves to be selective and will only allow Nami and Vivi to ride him, refusing the male crew members.
events.significance: Introduces Matsuge, a recurring animal companion for the Arabasta Arc. His name means 'eyelashes' in Japanese. This creates a transportation advantage for Nami and Vivi.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami names the camel after his distinctive eyelashes

events.title: Nami and Vivi Ride Ahead on Matsuge
events.description: Taking advantage of Matsuge's preference for female riders, Nami and Vivi ride ahead of the male crew members on the camel, leaving them to walk through the desert. The men become frustrated as they try to keep up in the scorching heat.
events.significance: Separates the crew temporarily and creates the situation where they encounter the Barbar Pirates separately. Also provides comedic relief as the men struggle in the heat.

events.title: Ace Gets Lost in the Desert
events.description: While trying to catch up with the Straw Hats, Ace somehow gets separated and lost in the desert. He encounters a giant scorpion which he easily defeats, leaving it smoking behind him as he continues to wander.
events.significance: Demonstrates Ace's strength casually while providing comedic relief. Shows that even powerful characters can get lost, establishing a recurring gag.

events.title: Encounter with the Barbar Pirates
events.description: The Straw Hat crew encounters the Barbar Pirates and their Sand Sled ship traveling through the desert. The Barbar Pirates are a group of desert pirates led by Barbarossa who sail the sands of Arabasta on a ship equipped with wheels and an umbrella figurehead.
events.significance: Introduces the central conflict of this filler arc. The Barbar Pirates are anime-exclusive characters who appear in episodes 97-99.

events.title: Luffy Accidentally Damages the Sand Sled
events.description: During the encounter with the Barbar Pirates, Luffy accidentally crashes into their Sand Sled ship and breaks the mast. Barbarossa is initially angry, but his lighthearted nature and the crew's belief in his pranks leads to a somewhat amicable resolution.
events.significance: Creates the obligation for the Straw Hats to help repair the ship, which drives the plot forward and leads to Vivi's reunion with Rasa.

events.title: Zaba and Rasa Assigned as Guides
events.description: To make amends for the damaged ship, Barbarossa orders two of his crew members - Zaba, a skilled sand sled navigator, and Rasa, the best navigator of the Barbar Pirates - to guide Luffy, Vivi, and others to find wood for repairs. They will travel to an old abandoned location.
events.significance: Introduces Zaba and Rasa, who become important to this episode's subplot. Rasa's introduction sets up the emotional reunion with Vivi.

events.title: Vivi Recognizes Rasa from Her Past
events.description: As they prepare to search for wood, Vivi notices something familiar about Rasa and begins to recall a memory from her childhood. She realizes that she met Rasa years ago during a royal tour of Arabasta with her father, King Cobra.
events.significance: Establishes the emotional core of this episode - the connection between Vivi and Rasa. This sets up the backstory reveal about the abandoned village and broken promise.

events.title: Flashback: Young Vivi Visits Melias
events.description: A flashback reveals that young Vivi visited the village of Melias during a royal tour with King Cobra. Rasa, a young girl from the village, gave Vivi a wreath as a gift. During this visit, Cobra promised to return and help the village if their oasis ever became buried in sand.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory for understanding Rasa's character and her complex feelings toward Vivi and the royal family. Sets up the broken promise theme.

events.title: Rasa's Tragedy: The Buried Oasis
events.description: The flashback continues to reveal that the oasis at Melias was eventually buried under sand, just as feared. King Cobra never returned to help as promised. The villagers abandoned Melias one by one, leaving Rasa as the sole resident, waiting alone until Barbarossa found her and recruited her into his crew.
events.significance: Explains Rasa's emotional pain and resentment. Shows the tragic consequences of broken promises and the drought affecting Arabasta. Provides context for why Rasa initially harbors negative feelings toward Vivi.

events.title: Journey to Find Wood Begins
events.description: The episode concludes with Luffy, Vivi, Zaba, and Rasa preparing to set out to find wood to repair the Sand Sled. The tension between Vivi and Rasa is palpable as they prepare for the journey together, setting up the emotional resolution to come.
events.significance: Sets up the events of Episode 99 where the group will travel to the ruins of Melias and Vivi and Rasa will confront their shared past.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy hallucinates after consuming psychoactive cactus

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami names the camel after his distinctive eyelashes

themes.description: The episode explores the pain of broken promises through Rasa's story. King Cobra's failure to return to Melias, despite his promise, left Rasa alone and resentful. This theme resonates with the larger Arabasta conflict where trust has been shattered.
themes.symbolism: The buried oasis symbolizes lost hope and abandoned dreams. The wreath Rasa gave Vivi represents innocence and trust that was later broken.

themes.description: The harsh desert environment serves as a constant challenge for the crew. The psychoactive cactus, dehydration, and dangerous creatures all emphasize the unforgiving nature of the Sandora Desert.
themes.symbolism: The desert represents the trials the crew must overcome to reach their goal. Each obstacle tests their resilience and determination.

themes.description: The title references 'The Men Who Live Freely' - the Barbar Pirates who sail the desert sands on their own terms. Despite the harsh environment and their anime-filler status, they represent the pirate ideal of living freely.
themes.symbolism: The Sand Sled ship represents freedom of movement even in the most restrictive environment. The umbrella figurehead suggests protection while maintaining independence.

themes.description: Vivi's encounter with Rasa highlights the weight of royal promises and the consequences when those in power fail to keep their word. It adds another layer to Vivi's understanding of her country's suffering.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between Vivi's privileged royal tour as a child and Rasa's eventual abandonment shows the gap between rulers and citizens.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's actions drive the plot through both his hallucinations from the cactus and accidentally damaging the Barbar Pirates' ship, creating the obligation to help them.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi confronts another consequence of her country's struggles as she reunites with Rasa and learns about the broken promise. This adds to her burden of responsibility for Arabasta.

characterSpotlights.development: Rasa is introduced as a skilled navigator hiding deep emotional wounds. Her backstory reveals the pain of abandonment and broken promises, setting up her character arc for resolution in the next episode.

characterSpotlights.development: Ace's tendency to get lost is showcased as he wanders the desert, easily defeating threats but unable to find his way.

mangaDifferences.difference: Episodes 98-99 are primarily anime filler content. The Barbar Pirates, Barbarossa, Zaba, Rasa, and Melias village are all anime-exclusive and do not appear in the manga.

The psychoactive cactus hallucination concept does appear in the manga around Chapter 162, but in Episode 98 it's only briefly shown. The full hallucination scene where Luffy fights Zoro occurs in Episode 102.
In the manga, Ace leaves the Straw Hats shortly after giving Luffy his Vivre Card. In the anime filler episodes 98-99, Ace remains with the crew longer (he leaves at the end of Episode 101).
Matsuge the camel is an anime addition who becomes a recurring character. While the crew does travel through the desert in the manga, Matsuge specifically is anime-original.

trivia.fact: This is a filler episode - anime-original content created to give the manga time to progress. Episodes 98, 99, 101, and 102 are filler episodes within the Arabasta Arc.
The episode's IMDb rating of 6.9/10 is lower than the series average, which is common for filler episodes that don't advance the main plot.
Matsuge's name literally means 'eyelashes' in Japanese (まつげ), referring to his distinctive long bottom eyelashes.
The ending theme 'fish' by The Kaleidoscope was used for only 12 episodes (95-106), making it one of the shorter-running One Piece endings.
The opening 'Believe' by Folder 5 is a Japanese cover of the Eurobeat song 'Dreamin' Of You' by Italian vocalist Elena Gobbi Frattini (performing as Lolita).
Sand Sleds, the desert ships used by the Barbar Pirates, are anime-exclusive vehicles that don't appear in the manga. They feature umbrella figureheads as protection from the desert sun.
This episode aired on January 27, 2002, during the height of One Piece's popularity in Japan, though it would be over 4 years before 4Kids aired it in the US and nearly 8 years for Funimation.
